channel.title: I need help
channel.description:
i keep getting this message when i try to compile or do something with a server
i get this message
the system cannot find the path specified.

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @hollow_lie hollow lie
item.description:
@hollow_lie wrote:

thank you

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Val Mod Val
item.description:
@Mod_Val wrote:

Edit this into your compiler.

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @xxpkpurexx xxpkpurexx
item.description:
@xxpkpurexx wrote:

make a path like this
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe
then go to ur compiler there should be something that says
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe
change this to ^ 16

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @mod_cody mod cody
item.description:
@mod_cody wrote:

lol you have to set the path to your JDK
usually something liek this
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe

Read full topic
